segment.source: Deciding Whether to Fix an Application or Deploy a Workaround (Windows 10)
segment.target: Deciding Whether to Fix an Application or Deploy a Workaround (Windows 10)

segment.source: You can fix a compatibility issue by changing the code for the application or by deploying a workaround.
segment.target: You can fix a compatibility issue by changing the code for the application or by deploying a workaround.

segment.source: Deciding Whether to Fix an Application or Deploy a Workaround
segment.target: Deciding Whether to Fix an Application or Deploy a Workaround

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: You can fix a compatibility issue by changing the code for the application or by deploying a workaround.
segment.target: You can fix a compatibility issue by changing the code for the application or by deploying a workaround.

segment.source: Fixing an Application
segment.target: Fixing an Application

segment.source: Fixing an application by changing the code is often the recommended way to address a compatibility issue.
segment.target: Fixing an application by changing the code is often the recommended way to address a compatibility issue.

segment.source: Although applying a fix to the code might involve higher initial costs or additional development time, it can limit long-term maintenance or operational costs.
segment.target: Although applying a fix to the code might involve higher initial costs or additional development time, it can limit long-term maintenance or operational costs.

segment.source: After you change the code, all users can use the application without encountering the issue.
segment.target: After you change the code, all users can use the application without encountering the issue.

segment.source: If you do not have access to the code, or if you do not have the time and resources to apply a fix, an alternative approach is to deploy a workaround.
segment.target: If you do not have access to the code, or if you do not have the time and resources to apply a fix, an alternative approach is to deploy a workaround.

segment.source: Deploying a Workaround
segment.target: Deploying a Workaround

segment.source: A workaround involves applying alternative registry settings to address a compatibility issue.
segment.target: A workaround involves applying alternative registry settings to address a compatibility issue.

segment.source: Deploying a workaround might be quicker and easier than changing the code, but you can incur long-term maintenance or operational costs.
segment.target: Deploying a workaround might be quicker and easier than changing the code, but you can incur long-term maintenance or operational costs.

segment.source: For example, you must make sure that new users have the correct set of features enabled or disabled on their computers.
segment.target: For example, you must make sure that new users have the correct set of features enabled or disabled on their computers.

segment.source: Using a workaround might also make your application or systems less secure.
segment.target: Using a workaround might also make your application or systems less secure.

segment.source: However, the overall security enhancement associated with deploying the newer version of Windows® may more than offset this reduction in security.
segment.target: However, the overall security enhancement associated with deploying the newer version of Windows® may more than offset this reduction in security.

segment.source: Consider changing registry settings as a short-term solution while you develop the long-term solution of changing the code.
segment.target: Consider changing registry settings as a short-term solution while you develop the long-term solution of changing the code.
